question: How wonderful is the ______ world!
The wide range of living types is ______.
The extraordinary ______ in which we find living organisms leave us speechless.
Living organisms can be found in cold mountains, deciduous forests, oceans, fresh water lakes, deserts or hot ______.
The beauty of a galloping ______ evokes awe and wonder.
The beauty of the ______ birds evokes a deep sense of wonder.
The beauty of the attacking ______ evokes awe.
Ecological conflict and ______ among members of a population make us reflect on life.
There is ecological cooperation among members of a ______ and among populations of a community.
The molecular ______ inside a cell makes us reflect on life.
The question ‘what indeed is ______?’ has two implicit sub-questions.
The first implicit question is a ______ one and seeks answer to what living is.
The second implicit question is a ______ one and seeks answer to what the purpose of life is.
As ______, we shall not attempt answering the second question.
We will try to reflect on – what is ______?
If you look around, you will see a large ______ of living organisms.
Examples of visible organisms include potted plants, insects, birds, your ______ or other animals.
There are also several organisms that you cannot see with your ______ eye.
If you increase the area of observation, the range and ______ of organisms you see increases.
A dense ______ would probably contain a much greater number and kinds of organisms.
Each different kind of plant, animal or organism represents a ______.
The number of species that are known and described ranges between ______ million.
Living organisms can be found in deciduous ______ and oceans.
The valley of ______ evokes awe and a deep sense of wonder.
The attacking shark evokes ______ and a deep sense of wonder.
The molecular traffic inside a ______ makes us reflect on life.
The first implicit question seeks answer to what living is as opposed to the ______.
Scientists will not attempt answering the ______ question.
Living organisms are found in fresh water ______ and hot springs.
The question ‘what indeed is life?’ contains ______ implicit questions.
The purpose of life is a ______ question, not a scientific one.
There are several organisms that you cannot see with your naked ______.
If you observe a greater ______, you see more kinds of organisms.
If you visit a dense forest, you would see a much greater number and ______ of living organisms.
Living organisms can be found in deserts or hot ______.
Conflict and cooperation occur among populations of a ______.
We try to reflect on what is ______, not why it exists.
Each different kind of organism you see represents a ______.
The number of known and described species ranges between 1.7 and ______ million.
You would see more species if you increased the area of your ______.
The beauty of the ______ birds evokes a sense of awe.
Ecological ______ occurs even at the molecular level inside cells.
Cold ______ are among the habitats where living organisms are found.
Organisms not visible to the naked eye are still found all around ______.
We try to reflect on what is living, not on the ______ of life.
The ______ of species diversity can be experienced in a dense forest.
Living organisms exist in diverse environments such as oceans and ______.
The ______ of a galloping horse evokes a deep sense of wonder.
Among members of a population, there is ecological ______ and cooperation.
Living organisms are found in cold mountains and hot ______.
Conflict among populations occurs within a ______.
What is living is a question with both technical and ______ dimensions.
The range of organisms increases with increase in the ______ of observation.
The ______ of flowers evokes awe and wonder.
You cannot see some organisms with your ______ eye.
As scientists, we reflect on what is ______.
The number of species known and described is around ______ million.
